newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysia noon rubber prices firm, trade quiet.
newsitem.headline: Malaysia noon rubber prices firm, trade quiet.

text.p: Malaysian rubber prices were firm at midday but trade was quiet, with buying interest having waned after recent short-covering, said traders.
"There were no inquiries or business reported this morning, but there could be some change this afternoon," said an official trade source.
At midday, June RSS 1 buyer was officially quoted at 278 cents ($1.11) a kg, up half cent from Thursday's close. June SMR 20 buyer was officially unchanged at 264.
Traders quoted the SMR20 at 260, SMR CV at 328, SMR 5 at 270, SMR L at 307, SMR 10 at 261 and drum latex at 226.
They said recent interventions into the Bangkok market by the Thai government led to a mild price rally and short-covering by international importers this week.
But this slowed down after prices stabilised, said traders.
"The European side seems to be readying now for the summer holidays," said another trader. "This is an indication that things will get worse."
